bibl.title: M. L. Coovert v. Clarke County. Petition for Writ of Habeas Corpus
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

msIdentifier.repository: National Archives and Records Administration, Seattle Branch, Washington
msIdentifier.collection: RG 21 US Circuit Courts, Western District of Washington, Seattle; Law Register Northern Division, 1890-1901, vol 1

div1.p:
In the Circuit Court of the United States, Ninth Circuit, District of Washington, Northern Division.
Ex parte : Petition for Writ of Habeas Corpus M. L. Coovert
Now comes Geo. Nerton, Sheriff of the County of Clarke, State of Washington, by his attorney C. D. Bowles, and demurs to the petition filled in the above entitled cause for the following reason, to-wit:
That the facts set forth in said petition do not state facts sufficient to constitute a cause for the reliefwrit prayed for, to-wit: the issuance of a writ of habeas corpus.
C. D. Bowles Attorney for Geo. Nerton, and Prosecuting attorney for the State of Washington, for the County of Clarke.
United States of America, District of Washington } SS
I, C. D. Bowles, do hereby certify that I am a regularly admitted and practicing attorney in the Circuit Court of the United States for the District of Washington, and I have examined the demurrer herein set forth and that the same is well founded in point of law.
C. D. Bowles

No. 275 In the United States Circuit Court for the District of Washington
Ex parte M. L. Coovert vs. Demurrer
Filed June 13 1893 A. Reeves Ayres Clerk. By R. M. Hopkins Deputy.
C. D. Bowles Attorney for George Nerton Sheriff
